description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4bomm","text":"Single cell RNA sequencing technique (scRNA-Seq) obtains gene expression profiles of individual cells for analysis, as opposed to comparing averaged gene expression signals between bulk samples of cells. The ability to examine transcriptional changes between individual cells at a high resolution uniquely define rare cell populations, identify heterogeneity within cell populations, investigate cell population dynamics in depth over time, and even interrogate cell signaling pathways.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cka2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbom5","text":"ScRNA sequencing enables the exploration of the cellular heterogeneity from the various biospecimen tissues; tumor, biopsy samples and organoid cells. To profile the immune repertoire of cells, full-length (5’ UTR to constant region), paired T-cell receptor (TCR) and/or B-cell receptor (BCR) transcripts from 500-10,000 individual cells per sample can be assessed. A pool of approximately 750,000 barcodes are sampled separately to index each cell’s transcriptome and antigen specificity. It is done by partitioning thousands of cells into nanoliter-scale Gel Beads-in-emulsion (GEMs), where all generated cDNA share a common 10x Barcode. Libraries are generated and sequenced and 10x Barcodes are used to associate individual reads back to the individual partitions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7da97","text":"Prepare master mix on ice. Pipette mix 15x and centrifuge briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0eiq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8roc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b1js6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":252,"id":442414,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbscabkp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbqcabkp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbrcabkp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbpcabkp.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"apmr3","text":"Add 37.2 μl Master Mix into each tube of a PCR 8-tube strip on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2nukj","text":"Assemble Chromium Next GEM Chip G:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvr1f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be39b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"av1hg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":527,"id":442418,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbwcabkp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbucabkp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbvcabkp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbtcabkp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lchs","text":"Load 50% Glycerol into Unused Chip Wells (if \u003c8 samples per chip): i. 70 ul to unused wells in row labeled 1. ii. 50 ul to unused wells in row labeled 2. iii. 45 ul to unused wells in row labeled 3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7s8so","text":"Prepare Master Mix + Cell Suspension. Refer to the Cell Suspension Volume Calculator Table. Add the appropriate volume of nuclease-free water and corresponding volume of single cell suspension to Master Mix for a total of 75 ul in each tube. Gently pipette mix the cells suspension before adding to the Master Mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ifcc","text":"Gently pipette mix the Master Mix + Cell Suspension and using the same pipette tip, dispense 70 ul Master Mix + Cell Suspension into the bottom center of each well in row labeled 1 without introducing bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0egl","text":"Snap the tube strip holder with the Gel Bead strip into a 10x Vortex Adapter. Vortex 30 sec. Centrifuge the Gel Bead strip for ~5 seconds. Confirm there are no bubbles at the bottom of the tubes and the liquid levels are even. Place the Gel Bead strip back in the holder. Secure the holder lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98kl9","text":"Puncture the foil seal of the Gel Bead tubes. Slowly aspirate 50 ul Gel Beads. Dispense into the wells in row labeled 2 without introducing bubbles. Wait 30 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fea2","text":"Dispense 45 ul Partitioning Oil into the wells in row labeled 3 from a reagent reservoir. Failure to add Partitioning Oil to the top row labeled 3 will prevent GEM generation and can damage the Chromium Controller.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5u9lk","text":"Attach 10x gasket (notch on top left)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"53mhb","text":"Place the assembled chip with the gasket into the tray of the Chromium Controller, ensuring the chip stays horizontal. Close the tray and press the play button to begin run (18 minutes). Complete next steps during run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aj6nh","text":"Place a PCR 8-tube strip on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6inb","text":"When chip run is complete, press the eject button of the Controller to remove the chip. Discard the gasket, open chip holder, and fold the lid back until it clicks to expose the wells at a 45-degree angle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6lki1","text":"Transfer 100 μl of GEMs into PCR strip tube. Pipette slowly. It should take ~20 seconds to pipette GEMs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2ju0","text":"If multiple chips are run back-to-back, cover the GEM-containing strip tube and place on ice for no more than 1 hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8vg70","text":"Run the following thermocycler program: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22ovp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b56of","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2os6q","text":"NOTE: Store at 4°C for up to 72 h or at −20°C for up to a week, or proceed to the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":201,"id":442422,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psb2cabkp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbycabkp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbzcabkp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psbxcabkp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9hg6t","text":"Add 125 ul Recovery Agent to each sample at room temperature. DO NOT pipette mix or vortex the biphasic mixture. Gently invert tube 10x to mix. Centrifuge briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cvm","text":"Slowly remove and discard 125 ul Recovery Agent/Partitioning Oil (pink) from the bottom of the tube. DO NOT aspirate any aqueous sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tcac","text":"Prepare Dynabeads Cleanup Mix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn45e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au7lb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cgb03","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":291,"id":442426,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psb6cabkp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psb4cabkp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psb5cabkp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psb3cabkp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12vti","text":"Vortex and add 200 μl of Dynabeads Cleanup Mix to each sample. Pipette mix 5x (pipette set to 200 ul).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e8rf5","text":"Incubate 10 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"74dj7","text":"Prepare Elution Solution I. Vortex and centrifuge briefly:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mpml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu0k4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7rb4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":197,"id":442430,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscacabkp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psb8cabkp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psb9cabkp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psb7cabkp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dn7ej","text":"At the end of 10 min incubation, place on the 10x Magnetic Separator, high position (Magnet – High) until the solution clears.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"so64","text":"Remove the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lk4","text":"Add 300 ul freshly prepared 80% ethanol to the pellet while on the magnet – High. Wait 30 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5r1su","text":"Remove the ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6v270","text":"Add 200 ul 80% ethanol to the pellet. Wait 30 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"kce9","text":"Remove the ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"45f75","text":"Centrifuge briefly. Place on the magnet – Low.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dr62g","text":"Remove the remaining ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1umdq","text":"Remove from the magnet. Immediately add 35.5 ul Elution Solution I to avoid clumping.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1n7u8","text":"Pipette mix 15x (pipette set to 30 ul) without introducing bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6fnqq","text":"Incubate 2 minutes at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0chj","text":"Centrifuge briefly. Place on the magnet – Low until the solution clears.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cs4cv","text":"Transfer 35 ul sample to a new tube strip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9dirt","text":"Prepare cDNA Amplification Mix on ice. Vortex and centrifuge briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3pd8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm89g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"12l40","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":224,"id":442434,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscecabkp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscccabkp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscdcabkp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscbcabkp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mtlt","text":"Add 65 ul cDNA Amplification Reaction Mix to 35 ul sample. Pipette mix 15x (pipette set to 90 ul). Centrifuge briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qb21","text":"Incubate in a thermal cycler with the following protocol. NOTE: Samples can be stored at 4°C up to 72 hours or at -20°C for up to 1 week or proceed to the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d0o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mrdh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ma58","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":562,"id":442438,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscicabkp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscgcabkp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pschcabkp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscfcabkp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75km1","text":"Ensure sample volume is 100 μl (bring up to 100 μl with Buffer EB if needed). Vortex to resuspend the SPRIselect reagent. Add 60 ul SPRIselect reagent (0.6X) to each sample and pipette mix 15x (pipette set to 150 ul).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3lgva","text":"Incubate 5 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"brv9u","text":"Place on the magnet – High until the solution clears (~5 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"46h62","text":"Remove the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ajmuq","text":"Add 200 ul of 80% ethanol to the pellet. Wait 30 sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7u7g","text":"Remove the ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fdmhg","text":"Repeat steps 43 and 44 for a total of 2 washes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9bd2n","text":"Centrifuge briefly and place on the magnet – High.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ragr","text":"Remove any remaining ethanol. Air dry for 2 minutes. DO NOT exceed 2 minutes as this will decrease elution efficiency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ben9p","text":"Remove from magnet. Add 45.5 ul Buffer EB. Pipette mix 15x.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fbu6n","text":"Incubate 2 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56lkk","text":"Place the tube strip on the magnet – High until the solution clears (~2 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3mjb","text":"Transfer 45 ul sample to a new tube strip and *Label the top of tubes with \"cDNA\". NOTE: Store at 4°C for up to 72 hours or at −20°C for up to 4 weeks or proceed to the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b843p","text":"Run 1 ul of sample on Qubit dsDNA HS Assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"32pbq","text":"Either run 1 ul of 1 ng/ul diluted sample on an Agilent Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity chip to determine fragment size.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m63v","text":"OR run 2 ul of 1 ng/ul diluted sample on the Agilent Tapestation High Sensitivity D1000 ScreenTape to determine fragment size.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3euu5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60fvo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3pl1s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":300,"id":442442,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscncabkp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psckcabkp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscmcabkp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pscjcabkp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmbtp","text":"Sequencing Libraries: Chromium Single Cell V(D)J Enriched libraries, 5' Gene Expression libraries, and Cell Surface Protein libraries comprise standard Illumina paired-end constructs which begin with P5 and end with P7. These libraries include 16 bp 10x Barcodes encoded at the start of TruSeq Read 1. Sample index sequences are incorporated as the i7 index read for V(D)J Enriched and 5' Gene Expression libraries; as i7 index read N for Cell Surface Protein library. TruSeq Read 1, TruSeq Read 2, and Nextera Read 2 (Read 2N) are all standard Illumina sequencing primer sites. TruSeq Read 1 and TruSeq Read 2 are used in paired-end sequencing of V(D)J Enriched and 5' Gene Expression libraries. TruSeq Read 1 and Nextera Read 2 (Read 2N) are used for paired-end sequencing of Cell Surface Protein library. Sequencing these libraries produce a standard Illumina BCL data output folder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7i7r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"abvml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":453,"id":442566,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psgkcabkp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psggcabkp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psgicabkp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/psgfcabkp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vpb0","text":"Illumina Sequencer Compatibility","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u78u","text":"The compatibility of the listed sequencers has been verified by 10x Genomics. {"blocks":[{"key":"72d8v","text":"Sample Indices","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6940h","text":"Each sample index in the Chromium i7 Sample Index Kit (PN-120262) and Chromium i7 Sample Index Kit Plate N, Set A (PN-1000084) is a mix of 4 different sequences to balance across all 4 nucleotides. If multiple libraries are pooled in a sequence lane, a separate sample index is needed with each library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
